Dare to Venture

October 19th - 21st

Weeks Days Hours

Sign Up

The Event

Looking to inspire and challenge our attendees, HackGT's 5th annual signature 36-hour hackathon will help students develop their skills, explore new technologies, and turn their curiosities into reality. Participants will be welcomed by friendly campgrounds, lush landscapes, and a spirit of adventure — inspired by the diverse beauty of America's National Parks from Yellowstone and the Grand Canyon to the Olympic Peninsula and Denali.

Tracks

This year, HackGT will be offering tracks that participants can choose from. We hope that by offering specialized tracks, you will better be able to connect with others.

FAQ's

What should I bring?

Bring your laptop, charger, headphones, and anything else you need. We'll supply hardware, meals, and snacks. More to come soon!

Who is eligible?

Any student over the age of 18 enrolled in a college or university is allowed to participate, but anyone can be a mentor or volunteer. Teams can be up to four members - you can register with your team when you apply, or any time after you’re accepted, but you can also create a team at the event!

Are there any costs?

The event is free, thanks to our sponsors! We will offer travel reimbursement -- just indicate where you’re coming from when you apply, and we’ll reach out to you.

Can I use past projects?

True to the spirit of hackathons, you may not submit your past projects to HackGT.

Do I need any experience to apply?

Experience isn’t required. Hackathons are a place to learn for anybody at any level. Some of our past winners are also first-timers at a hackathon. But, if you’re still not convinced, like our Facebook page for updates about workshops or events we’ll host before HackGT that’ll teach you some introductory skills!

More questions? Ask away! Our adventure experts are happy to help so send us an email at hello@hack.gt!

Registration

Applications for participants are open now! Dare to venture into the opportunity of a lifetime!

All attendees, mentors, volunteers, and staff are required to adhere to the MLH Code of Conduct to ensure this is a safe and fun adventure for everyone.
